It features showy, crimson bracts that resemble cat tails, which are actually modified leaves rather than flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with a velvety texture and a deep green color, adding visual interest to gardens. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Acalypha spectabilis is often cultivated for its vibrant foliage and unique floral display.
